Instruction: Wash the eggplant and trim off the ends. Cut the eggplant in half lengthwise.
Heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the eggplant pieces and cook, turning occasionally, until browned and softened on all sides (around 8-10 minutes per side).

While the eggplant cooks, whisk together gochugaru, soy sauce, sesame oil, honey, fish sauce (if using), garlic, and sugar (if using) in a small bowl. Adjust the amount of gochugaru depending on your desired spice level.
Once the eggplant is cooked, transfer it to a plate and let it cool slightly.
Once cool enough to handle, tear the eggplant lengthwise into thin strips using your fingers or cut them into bite-sized pieces with a knife.
Transfer the eggplant strips to a serving bowl.
Pour the prepared sauce over the eggplant and toss gently to coat evenly.
Garnish with sliced scallions and sesame seeds.
Serve Gaji Namul at room temperature or slightly chilled as a side dish with Korean meals.
